title: I've been chat restricted after 4,5 years being ''clean''
body:
And I don't feel any regret. Not even the slightest.
With the type of teammates I've been playing with within the last week everyone would've got one.

When you get 2 AFK's, 4 intentional feeders and a bunch of trolls who use their abilities against your team in just a few days while you just sit there, losing every single game to them?

Yea, every decent normal human being might become a bit upset after you experience that.

But sure, it's me that needs a restriction, one of the few team members who are actually trying to win,
not the actual people who troll and go afk. They are free to ruin everyone's game.

I couldn't care less about someone using bad words as long as they contribute to winning the actual goddamn match.
Because when I queue up for ranked, I don't look for friendly conversation, I look to win.

replies.body: Why do you think you re the only one getting punished
And guess which is easier to detect?

A-fucking-men.

Y'know, why do we have to even lose our LP (or how about just a little) if someone leaves/afks/trolls/ints/wtvr?

Would probably be a lot less people going, "u lost and that's all i care about lol" in post-game lobbies because then what would be the point? They'd know they did it for absolutely nothing.

Loss protection when your team has a self-admitted troll, Riot.
b-b-but you said a bad word :(((((((( that's far worse than legitimately throwing and making games unplayable :((((

I have been saying the same for about 1.5 years now, only been getting down-voted. The fact is 90% of community is really toxic, this was shown by the recent icon rewards given out.On my main, I was 14-day banned twice in 5 months duration and I still managed to get 2 icons out of 5. The thing is perma-ban for flaming is not a solution, Riot just wants to cash up money so that people who get account banned spend on the new one's. Of-course flaming new people is bad that is why keep it implemented for normals/ARAM, but Riot should keep the flame bans away from Ranked, where people want to try hard and expect others to do their best too.
